titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader, September 26, 1875

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
Republic of Liberia

J Milton Turner
To the
Department of State
Washington D.C.
Acknowldging Consular despatch No. 1. and transmitting summary of fees received during the year 1874.

Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia 29th September 1875.

I have the honor to receive your No. 1. desiring me to fill consular form No. 105. with which it was accompanied, but to-day; and I hasten to comply with your instruction, and inclose herewith the form filled as requested by you.
I will hereafter endeavor to avoid making the same omission in my December reports. Be pleased to forward to me a few copies of form No. 105.

I have the honor to be,
Sir/
With high considerations and esteem/
Your obedient servant,
J Milton Turner
div1.fw:
Honorable
John L. Cadwalader
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington U.S.A.
div1.p: Aggregate Return of all fees received at the Consulate General of the United States at Monrovia Liberia, and the Consular Agencies connected with it, from January 1st 1874 to December 31st 1874 inclusive

row.cell: Fees for the quarter ending March the 31st
Fees for the quarter ending June the 30th
Fees for the quarter ending September the 30th
Fees for the quarter ending Dec 31st
